Veena George says no need to worry about HMPV infection - The Hindu
summary:
Veena George says no need to worry about HMPV infection

Date: January 07, 2025
Source: The Hindu

Health Minister Veena George reassured the public that there is no need for panic regarding the Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV), stating that most circulating information is false and that the virus has been previously detected in the state.

  • George reported that the Institute of Advanced Virology has detected 11 cases of HMPV in 2023 and 2024.
  • She advised precautions for vulnerable populations including those with low immunity, pregnant women, and the elderly.
  • The Minister emphasized wearing masks in crowded areas but noted no travel restrictions are in place.
  • George inaugurated various development projects at Thrissur Government Medical College Hospital, including a substation and new health facilities.
  • The Minister also launched renovations at the Mundathikode Family Health Centre.
“The claim that it is being reported for the first time in the country is completely false.” - Veena George

The public is encouraged to remain calm and informed as health authorities monitor the situation closely.
newTitle: Veena George addresses concerns over HMPV infection, emphasizes public safety

Source: News18

Salman Khan has upgraded security at his Mumbai residence amid ongoing threats to his life. His balcony is now protected by bullet proof glass following previous gunfire incidents linked to a local gang.

  • Upcoming film release, 'Sikandar', planned for Eid 2025.

title: More breast cancer cases found when AI used in screenings, study finds - The Guardian
summary:
More breast cancer cases found when AI used in screenings, study finds

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: The Guardian

This article discusses a study revealing that the use of artificial intelligence (AI) in breast cancer screenings significantly improves detection rates without increasing false positives.

  • The study analyzed data from 461,818 women in a national breast cancer screening program in Germany.
  • AI was used in the screening of 260,739 women, resulting in a 6.7% increase in cancer detection rates.
  • The AI tool provides “safety net” alerts for potentially suspicious scans that may have been overlooked.
  • A total of 2,881 women were diagnosed with breast cancer; the adjusted detection rate rose to 17.6% higher in the AI group.
  • Important considerations were raised regarding the implications of detecting more in situ cancers.
“We could improve the detection rate without increasing the harm for the women taking part in breast cancer screening,” - Prof Alexander Katalinic

The study highlights the potential for AI technology to enhance breast cancer detection, but underscores the need for cautious integration into existing healthcare systems.
newTitle: AI Enhances Detection of Breast Cancer in Screening Programs

title: Mominul voices concern over potential two-tier Test system - Cricbuzz
summary:
Mominul voices concern over potential two-tier Test system

Published on: Tue, Jan 7, 2025, 02:01 PM

Bangladesh batter Mominul Haque expressed his frustration over the proposed two-tier Test structure that could devalue the longer format of the game in Bangladesh.

  • Reports suggest the 'Big Three' (India, Australia, England) are in discussions to implement a two-division Test cricket structure.
  • The proposed system would be introduced after the current Future Tours Program ends in 2027.
  • Mominul is concerned about the potential reduction in the number of Test matches and the implications for player development.
  • The International Cricket Council is set to discuss the proposal with representatives from Australia and England.
  • Mominul emphasizes that playing against stronger teams is critical for the growth and improvement of Test cricket.
“It's frustrating for me. I am not sure whether we can progress to the first tier if we play well in the second tier... The value of Test cricket will go down if this happens.” - Mominul Haque

The conversation surrounding the two-tier system continues to raise concerns about the future of Test cricket and its impact on player development and the game's overall value.
newTitle: Mominul voices concern over potential two-tier Test system

Actor Ajith Kumar returned to racing after over a decade and faced an incident during a practice run for the 24H Dubai 2025, losing control of his car but fortunately escaping unhurt.

  • Ajith crashed his race car into a barrier during a practice session.
  • The crash occurred around 12:45 PM local time.
  • His team confirmed that he was unharmed and immediately switched to another car to continue practice.
  • Ajith Kumar owns a racing team called Ajith Kumar Racing.
  • The 24H Dubai 2025 is scheduled for January 11-12.
“Yes, he narrowly escaped an accident… Ajith shifted to another race car because this one was totalled and continued practice. Thankfully, he is unharmed.” – Ajith's team

This incident underscores Ajith's return to competitive racing and his dedication to the sport after a long hiatus.
newTitle: Ajith Kumar's Race Car Crash Ahead of 24H Dubai 2025

title: Lunar Temperature Fluctuations: Understanding the Moon's Extreme Conditions - Gadgets 360
summary:
Lunar Temperature Fluctuations: Understanding the Moon's Extreme Conditions

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Gadgets 360

The surface temperature of the moon experiences extreme variations, making it one of the harshest environments in the solar system.

  • During lunar daylight, temperatures can exceed 100 degrees Celsius.
  • In the absence of an atmosphere, lunar temperatures can drop to minus 100 degrees Celsius at night.
  • The moon's regolith significantly influences these temperature shifts.
  • Shaded areas within lunar pits maintain a steady temperature of 17 degrees Celsius, suggesting potential for human habitation.
  • Permanently shadowed craters at the lunar poles may host temperatures as low as minus 248.15 degrees Celsius.
Understanding the moon's thermal dynamics is essential for designing equipment capable of withstanding its conditions.

The extreme temperatures on the moon highlight the challenges of future lunar exploration and potential settlements.
newTitle: Lunar Temperature Fluctuations: Understanding the Moon's Extreme Conditions

Justin Trudeau's ‘one regret’ as he steps down as Canada PM: Here's what he said - Hindustan Times
summary:
Justin Trudeau Announces Resignation as Canada PM, Reflects on Tenure

Date: Monday, October 9, 2023 Source: Hindustan Times

On Monday, Justin Trudeau announced his resignation as Prime Minister of Canada, marking the end of his nine-year tenure. He emphasized the need for Canadians to have a 'real choice' in the next election.

  • Trudeau's leadership has faced challenges with public discontent over rising prices and housing shortages.
  • He expressed regret over not reforming Canada's electoral system to allow more voting choices.
  • The Liberal Party will choose a new leader through a nationwide process.
  • Trudeau reflected that he cannot lead if he is engaged in internal party battles.
"If I have one regret... I do wish we’d been able to change the way we elect our governments." - Justin Trudeau

Trudeau aims to support the new leader in carrying forward the Liberal Party ideals as they prepare for the upcoming election.
newTitle: Justin Trudeau Announces Resignation as Canada PM, Reflects on Tenure

title: Central Govt Gives Nod to Memorial for Former President Pranab Mukherjee | LIVE - Republic World
India FY25 GDP growth seen at four-year low of 6.4% on weak manufacturing, sluggish investment - The Indian Express
summary:
India's GDP Growth at 4-Year Low of 6.4% Amid Weak Manufacturing and Investment

Date: December 2024

Source: Indian Express

India’s GDP is projected to grow at 6.4% in FY25, marking a four-year low, largely due to weak industrial and investment growth as per the first advance estimates released by the National Statistics Office.

  • GDP growth for FY25 lower than Reserve Bank of India estimate (6.6%) and government estimate (6.5-7%).
  • Strong slowdown in primary and secondary sectors with exceptions in agriculture.
  • Manufacturing GVA growth expected to decline to 5.3% from 9.9% in FY24.
  • Private final consumption expenditure is expected to rise significantly to 7.3% in FY25.
  • Government final consumption expenditure expected to grow at 4.1%, an increase from 2.5% in the previous year.
“The lower GDP growth for FY25 has been the result of a cyclical slowdown in the Indian economy in the past three quarters.” - Paras Jasrai, Senior Economic Analyst, India Ratings and Research

This decline indicates potential challenges ahead for the Indian economy, with implications for future fiscal and monetary policies.
newTitle: India's GDP Growth at 4-Year Low of 6.4% Amid Weak Manufacturing and Investment

"I am immensely touched by this honor. My father dedicated his life to India." - Sharmistha Mukherjee

title: Eyewitness video captures destruction after powerful earthquake rocks Tibet - Hindustan Times
summary:
Powerful Earthquake in Tibet Captured on Eyewitness Video

Date: January 07, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

A powerful earthquake measuring 6.8 struck the foothills of the Himalayas near one of Tibet's holiest cities, resulting in 95 fatalities and numerous destroyed homes. Eyewitness video shared by Reuters showcases the extensive destruction, with rubble clogging the streets.

  • The epicenter was approximately 80 km north of Mount Everest.
  • Tremors also impacted neighboring countries, including Nepal, Bhutan, and India.
  • The earthquake occurred at a depth of 10 km in Tingri county.
  • The Dalai Lama expressed his sorrow and prayers for victims.
  • Rescue operations are ongoing, with reports of significant damage and injuries.
“I offer my prayers for those who have lost their lives and extend my wishes for a swift recovery to all who have been injured.” - Dalai Lama

This earthquake adds to a historic pattern of seismic activity in the region, raising concerns for future occurrences.
newTitle: Powerful Earthquake in Tibet Captured on Eyewitness Video

title: OYO Results: Hotels chain operator earned ₹114.64 crore net profit in FY2024; Revenue drop 15% | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
OYO Results: Hotels chain operator reports ₹114.64 crore net profit in FY2024, revenue drop 15%

Date & Source: March 2024, Live Mint

OYO Hotels and Homes Pvt. Ltd. has reported a net profit for FY2024, despite a significant drop in operational revenue compared to the previous year.

  • The company reported a net profit of ₹114.64 crore for FY2024, an improvement from the previous year's loss.
  • Operational revenue decreased by 15%, totaling ₹1,112.83 crore.
  • OYO achieved its first positive EBITDA since 2020, reported at ₹153 crore.
  • Total revenue for March 2024 was ₹1,179 crore, compared to ₹1,400 crore in the previous year.
  • OYO's first-ever post-tax profit was ₹229 crore, exceeding earlier profit projections.
  • Earnings per share improved to approximately ₹0.36 from a loss of ₹1.93 per share in FY23.
  • The company expanded its hotel portfolio significantly, growing inventory from 12,938 to 18,103 hotels.
“The company's reported profits for FY24 significantly exceeded CEO Ritesh Agarwal's earlier projection of ₹100 crore.”

In conclusion, OYO's financial recovery in FY2024 is notable, highlighting a turnaround amidst declining revenue but with an expansion in its hotel operations.
newTitle: OYO Hotels Reports ₹114.64 Crore Profit Despite Revenue Decline

Video captured from Space Station shows Earth bathed in intense green aurora - India Today
summary:
Video Captured from Space Station Shows Earth Bathed in Intense Green Aurora

Published On: Jan 7, 2025 | Source: India Today

Nasa astronaut Don Pettit has captivated audiences worldwide with a stunning video showcasing the vibrant green auroras from the International Space Station (ISS).

  • The video highlights the breathtaking natural light display caused by charged particles from the Sun interacting with Earth’s magnetic field.
  • It emphasizes the beauty of this celestial spectacle as seen from space.
  • The video offers a rare glimpse of the auroras typically visible in high-latitude regions.
  • Pettit’s post was captioned “Flying over aurora; intensely green,” drawing admiration on social media.
  • The ISS orbits approximately 400 kilometers above Earth, providing unique documentation opportunities.
“Flying over aurora; intensely green.” - Don Pettit

This captivating video further showcases the incredible sights that can be witnessed beyond our atmosphere, illustrating the complexity of solar activity's impact on Earth's environment.
newTitle: Video Captured from Space Station Shows Earth Bathed in Intense Green Aurora

title: "Forget Playing For India": Jasprit Bumrah Sent Stern Message By World Cup Winner Amid Workload Talk.. - NDTV Sports
summary:
Forget Playing For India: Jasprit Bumrah Sent Stern Message By World Cup Winner Amid Workload Talks

Publication Date: 2025-01-05
Source: NDTV Sports

The discussion around the workload of Indian bowlers has intensified following Jasprit Bumrah's recent injury during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2024/25. World Cup-winning cricketer Balwinder Singh Sandhu expressed strong opinions on the concept of workload management in cricket.

  • Bumrah bowled 151.2 overs during the Test series, while Mohammed Siraj bowled 164.1 overs.
  • Sandhu stated that bowlers should be able to bowl 20 overs a day, challenging the modern focus on workload management.
  • He criticized the term 'workload management' as a foreign concept and a creation of Australian cricket.
  • Sandhu emphasized that cricketers used to listen to their bodies in his era and noted that Bumrah should reconsider his commitment to the national team if he cannot meet traditional bowling demands.
“If a bowler can't bowl 20 overs in an innings, he should forget about playing for India,” said Sandhu.

As Bumrah's status for the Champions Trophy remains uncertain, his recovery will be closely monitored.
newTitle: Jasprit Bumrah Receives Stern Workload Message from World Cup Winner

title: HMPV virus cases live: No patients detected in Punjab, Nagpur; Officials urge ‘calm’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
No HMPV Virus Cases Detected in Punjab and Nagpur; Officials Urge Calm

Publication Date: January 7, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The recent outbreak of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) has raised concerns, but health officials in Punjab and Nagpur have reported no patients detected and are urging the public to remain calm.

  • Five HMPV cases were reported in various parts of India.
  • Health officials advise states to strengthen awareness and preventive measures.
  • Authorities confirm that HMPV is a common respiratory virus, not a new pathogen.
  • Children below three years and immunocompromised individuals are advised to exercise caution.
  • States like Odisha and Uttar Pradesh are increasing health department readiness.
“There is no need to panic, there is no such situation...so there is nothing to fear,” said Dr. Nilam Patel, Additional Director of Public Health in Gujarat.

Despite isolated cases, health officials emphasize the importance of public awareness and preparedness in dealing with respiratory illnesses.
newTitle: No HMPV Virus Cases Detected in Punjab and Nagpur; Officials Urge Calm
